 I once knew a girl who got rejected when applying for a job at Waffle House...she had too many teeth.

I had a dentist friend in San Francisco who would have liked weekly checkups, but he was after early retirement. His saying, like most dentists, was that to a dentist there are only good teeth that need constant, expensive attention. He actually disliked his profession, especially the children, but made a fortune out of multiple offices specializing in childrens 'corrective' dentistry, braces for the very young children of insecure parents.
